number.desc:
Angle used when jumping towards the right

default = 290

Angle used when jumping towards the left

default = 250

Amount of force to apply during the jump

default = 65

snippet.desc: Performs a sweep of raycasts in the direction the actor is facing, and creates a list of actors that can be seen. If a ray hits an actor, no actors behind that actor will be seen. Actor types in the transparent actors list will be ignored.
snippet.description: Performs a sweep of raycasts in the direction the actor is facing, and creates a list of actors that can be seen. If a ray hits an actor, no actors behind that actor will be seen. Actor types in the transparent actors list will be ignored.
snippet.name: Get Actors In View PM

snippet.desc: When the actor is created, a random direction in which to travel is applied.
snippet.description: When the actor is created, a random direction in which to travel is applied.
snippet.name: Walk In Random Direction On Start PM

snippet.desc: When the AI has line of sight to an actor from the specified list, it will move towards it.
snippet.description: When the AI has line of sight to an actor from the specified list, it will move towards it.

snippet.desc: When this actor hits an AI Trigger actor with the id "Turn Around", it will switch direction.

snippet.desc: If the Actor falls off the bottom of the screen, the scene will be reloaded.
snippet.description: If the Actor falls off the bottom of the screen, the scene will be reloaded.
snippet.name: Die in Pit

snippet.desc: Plays an animation and stops the character when they reach the end of a platform. A distance should be set within which the behaviour will operate. Optionally a speed can be set, under which the player will not teeter. Requires a "Left Platform" and "Right Platform" group to be created and added to the behaviour.
snippet.description: Plays an animation and stops the character when they reach the end of a platform. A distance should be set within which the behaviour will operate. Optionally a speed can be set, under which the player will not teeter. Requires a "Left Platform" and "Right Platform" group to be created and added to the behaviour.
snippet.name: Edge Teeter PM

text.desc: Set the category used for the animation - used for the hierarchy.

snippet.desc: When the AI hits an object, it will reverse X direction.

Enter in a list of animation categories.

the ones below it.

number.desc:
Rate of slowdown while on the ground and movement keys are not being pressed.

default = 0.9

number.desc:
Rate of slowdown while in the air.

default = 0.99
number.name: _AirSlowdown

number.desc:
Rate of slowdown while ducking.

default = 0.975
number.name: _DuckingSlowdown

number.desc:
Rate of slowdown while moving through the air.

default = 0.975
number.name: _MovingAirSlowdown

number.desc:
Rate of slowdown while on the ground, a movement key is being pressed, and the Actor is over its max speed. This will slow the Actor back down to the max speed.

default = 0.9

snippet.desc: Behaviour for collectable items. Collectable Id is used to make sure items that have already been collected can be removed. This should only be set in the Scene Editor. If there is an item called *Actor Type* Inventory, the item will be displayed in the inventory.
snippet.description: Behaviour for collectable items. Collectable Id is used to make sure items that have already been collected can be removed. This should only be set in the Scene Editor. If there is an item called *Actor Type* Inventory, the item will be displayed in the inventory.

snippet.description: A switch that switches between on and off states each time the player jumps on it. Effect is immediate.
snippet.name: Toggle Region Switch PM

snippet.desc: Every time the given actor moves, the actor's position is updated so that it is always in the same relative position as it was when created.

snippet.description: A switch that switches once from start state to on or off when the player jumps on it. Effect is immediate.

snippet.desc: Kills the object when it is hit by another object travelling above a certain velocity. A value of -1 will prevent kills from that side.
snippet.description: Kills the object when it is hit by another object travelling above a certain velocity. A value of -1 will prevent kills from that side.

text.dropdown: None=None Jump Over=Jump Over Turn Around=Turn Around
text.name: _TriggerId

number.desc: An arbitrary value that can be used for tuning a triggers behaviour.
number.name: _TriggerValue

text.dropdown: None=None Normal In=Normal In Strong In=Strong In Normal Out=Normal Out Strong Out=Strong Out
text.name: _EaseType

Kill When Out Of Scene PM

snippet.desc: Has a list of states in the format: StateId:behaviour1=0,behaviour2=1 etc. where 0 means send a "Deactivated" event to the behaviour and 1 means send an "Activated" signal to the behaviour when changing to the state.
snippet.description: Has a list of states in the format: StateId:behaviour1=0,behaviour2=1 etc. where 0 means send a "Deactivated" event to the behaviour and 1 means send an "Activated" signal to the behaviour when changing to the state.
snippet.name: Super Simple State Machine PM

snippet.desc: The specified target will update to be always be positioned at the same offset from this actor.

list.desc: For each connection, specify the input(N/E/S/W), then the output, then the target type (Pipe = P/Activation = A) e.g. NW connects from North to West. If the pipe should be 2 way, then you will need 2 connections, i.e. NW and WN.

number.desc: Moves the position where the screen will change to the right.

actor.desc: The object the scene camera is focussed on.

number.desc: How high a single screen is (note that this is not the same as the device screen dimensions)

Amount of force applied when swimming.
Default = 35

Amount of force applied when swimming(mobile only).
Default = 35
number.name: _MobileSwimForce

number.desc:
When releasing the jump key before reaching the max
height, what is the rate of upward slowdown?

default = 0.75
number.name: _SwimmingSlowdown

number.desc:
Maximum amount of time that the
swim force will be applied when holding down the swim button.

default = 0.075
number.name: _MaxSwimTime

snippet.name: Shoot Laser When Player Spotted PM

snippet.desc: A door that moves the player to the new scene as soon as the player interacts with it. This kind of door is always open. Will move the player to the y position that they left from.
snippet.description: A door that moves the player to the new scene as soon as the player interacts with it. This kind of door is always open. Will move the player to the y position that they left from.
snippet.name: Horizontal Scene Exit PM

snippet.desc: Creates a series of movements to be performed in a loop. Movements can be Slide (moves x/y), Spin (moves x/y), Fade or Pause. Movements can be sequential or concurrent. Note that in a concurrent movement, the first actions duration will be used for triggering the next action in the list. When using concurrent actions, a sequential action or a pause (even if 0 length) must be used to prevent infinite loops.
snippet.description: Creates a series of movements to be performed in a loop. Movements can be Slide (moves x/y), Spin (moves x/y), Fade or Pause. Movements can be sequential or concurrent. Note that in a concurrent movement, the first actions duration will be used for triggering the next action in the list. When using concurrent actions, a sequential action or a pause (even if 0 length) must be used to prevent infinite loops.
snippet.name: Complex Movement PM

list.desc: A list of the movements, using the format Type:Movement:Duration:Ease:Param1:Param2. Type is S for sequential or C for concurrent. Movement is Slide To, Slide By, Spin To, Spin By, Fade, Grow or Pause. Duration is the time of the movement in seconds. Ease is any of the available eases(None/Back/Elastic(Bounce)/Quad(Normal)/Expo(Strong).easeIn/easeInOut/easeOut). Param1 and 2 depend on the movement. For Slide they will be X:Y. For Grow, width and height. For Spin and Fade, only Param1 is used, for the angle in degrees and target alpha respectivelly. For Pause, no params are used.
list.name: _Movements

number.desc: Set the amount of time the screen will fade after dying. In and Out will be the same.
number.name: _FadeTime
